newsitem.title: USA: Intuit won't be captive, chairman says.
newsitem.headline: Intuit won't be captive, chairman says.

text.p: Intuit Inc Chairman Scott Cook on Friday declined to directly address the rumoured merger talks with American Express Co, although he reiterated earlier comments that his company will never be "captive" to one financial institution.
"Our strategy is not to be the captive of a single institution or a small group of institutions," Cook told reporters at the Securities Industry Association meeting.
But Cook also noted that his comments did not mean Intuit will not consider a merger, recalling its earlier failed effort to be acquired by Microsoft Corp
Intuit stock was up 2 3/8 at 36 in afternoon trade.

Cook also said that Intuit could survive and thrive as an independent company. When directly asked about the possibility of an acquisition by American Express, he refused comment, citing company policy against addressing rumours.
Testy at times after repeated questioning about the rumours, Cook took a lighter turn when asked if he carried an American Express card.
He does not, he said, adding, "I think Amex is a good business, it just doesn't make sense for me."
